How to access shared Windows folders on Android (SMB)


Enable file sharing on Windows

Open Control Panel, click Select Homegroup and Sharing Options under Network and Internet, then click Change advanced sharing settings, enable Files and Printer Sharing" feature.


Additional file sharing settings

You may also want to configure other advanced sharing settings here. 
 For example, if you trust everything, allow access to your files without a password devices on your local network. After enabling file and printer sharing, you can Open File Explorer or Windows Explorer, right-click the folder you want to share, and Select properties. 
 Click the "Share" button and make the folder available on the network. 


Make sure both devices are on the same Wifi

This feature makes files available on the local network, so your PC and mobile devices Must be on the same local network. You cannot access shared Windows folders Over the Internet or when your smartphone is connected to its mobile data - it Must be connected to Wi-Fi. 


Find IP address

Open a command prompt. Type "ipconfig" and press Enter. Find the default gateway Find the router's IP address under Network adapters. Look for "IPv4 Address" under the same adapter section to find your computer's IP address. 


Enter details in the SMB dialog

Someone might be doing something nasty! 

Someone may be eavesdropping on you right now (man-in-the-middle attack)! It's also possible that the host key has just been changed. The public key fingerprint sent by the remote host does not match the public key fingerprint stored in Amaze. 

Please contact your system administrator or set up a new connection to continue connecting to the server.

AESCrypt is an open source file encryption format based on AES encryption. It is also portable and can be decrypted using the AESCrypt program on other platforms.

AESCrypt website

Amaze\'s encryption format is also based on AES encryption; but unlike the AESCrypt format, it can only be decrypted by this device; in addition, you must not uninstall Amaze file manager from this device, nor change the method of locking the screen, otherwise you will Encrypted files will not be recoverable.
Encrypted files must use ".aze" as the file extension.
Encrypted files must use ".aes" as the file extension.

Grant SAF access to the FTP server

Since this is your first time running the FTP server , and you are using your device\'s internal storage as a shared folder, so please allow Amaze to access storage using Security Armed Forces. \n\n
You only have to do this once until the next time you choose a new share location.

Since Android 10, Android imposes restrictions on certain directories that need to be accessed through the Storage Access Framework. \n \nPlease click "Allow Access" to allow Amaze to access this directory from the system file manager.
Enable this option to support using device external storage on newer Android versions
When you When switching back, the FTP server share path was reset to the internal storage legacy filesystem implementation. Use the menu in the upper right corner to select a new path as needed.
FTP server share path has been reset to internal storage
You are selecting a path that requires root access. If your device is rooted, please enable root browser in settings.

The path you have chosen requires root access, which enables read/write access to the entire filesystem on your device, which is dangerous - accidentally make a mistake and brick your device! \n\nAre you sure?

As of Android 11, Google requires file managers to request user permission to manage all files on the device. Details here. 

Amaze file manager also needs this permission. After pressing "Grant" here, please select the "Allow access to manage all files" option on the next screen. 

Canceling this dialog will exit the application.
